   20: -module(compile_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests compile:file/1 and compile:file/2 with various options.
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/erl_compile.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 app_test/1,appup_test/1,bigE_roundtrip/1,
   30: 	 debug_info/4, custom_debug_info/1, custom_compile_info/1,
   31: 	 file_1/1, forms_2/1, module_mismatch/1, outdir/1,
   32: 	 binary/1, makedep/1, cond_and_ifdef/1, listings/1, listings_big/1,
   33: 	 other_output/1, encrypted_abstr/1,
   34: 	 strict_record/1, utf8_atoms/1, utf8_functions/1, extra_chunks/1,
   35: 	 cover/1, env/1, core_pp/1, tuple_calls/1,
   36: 	 core_roundtrip/1, asm/1, asm_labels/1,
   37: 	 sys_pre_attributes/1, dialyzer/1, no_core_prepare/1,
   38:          beam_ssa_pp_smoke_test/1,
   39: 	 warnings/1, pre_load_check/1, env_compiler_options/1,
   40:          bc_options/1, deterministic_include/1, deterministic_paths/1,
   41:          compile_attribute/1, message_printing/1, other_options/1,
   42:          transforms/1, erl_compile_api/1, types_pp/1, bs_init_writable/1,
   43:          annotations_pp/1, option_order/1
   44: 	]).
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: %% To cover the stripping of 'type' and 'spec' in beam_asm.
   49: -type all_return_type() :: [atom()].
   50: -spec all() -> all_return_type().
   51: 
   52: all() -> 
   53:     [app_test, appup_test, bigE_roundtrip, file_1,
   54:      forms_2, module_mismatch, outdir,
   55:      binary, makedep, cond_and_ifdef, listings, listings_big,
   56:      other_output, encrypted_abstr, tuple_calls,
   57:      strict_record, utf8_atoms, utf8_functions, extra_chunks,
   58:      cover, env, core_pp, core_roundtrip, asm, asm_labels, no_core_prepare,
   59:      sys_pre_attributes, dialyzer, beam_ssa_pp_smoke_test,
   60:      warnings, pre_load_check,
   61:      env_compiler_options, custom_debug_info, bc_options,
   62:      custom_compile_info, deterministic_include, deterministic_paths,
   63:      compile_attribute, message_printing, other_options, transforms,
   64:      erl_compile_api, types_pp, bs_init_writable, annotations_pp,
   65:      option_order].
   66: 
   67: groups() -> 
   68:     [].
   69: 
   70: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   71:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   75:     ok.
   76: 
   77: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   78: 	Config.
   79: 
   80: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   81: 	Config.
   82: 
   83: 
   84: 
   85: %% Test that the Application file has no `basic' errors.";
   86: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   87:     test_server:app_test(compiler).
   88: 
   89: %% Test that the Application upgrade file has no `basic' errors.";
   90: appup_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     ok = test_server:appup_test(compiler).
   92: 
   93: %% Check that a file compiled to the abstract form and dumped with -E
   94: %% can be compiled. We use a file constructed to produce errors if the
   95: %% dumping fails to legalize compiler generated variable names.
   96: bigE_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   97:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   98:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   99:     Source = filename:join(DataDir, "bigE.erl"),
  100:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bigE"),
  101:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.E"),
  102:     TargetSource = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.erl"),
  103:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  104:     io:format("Source: ~p~nTargetDir: ~p~nTarget: ~p\n",
  105:               [Source, TargetDir, Target]),
  106:     case compile:file(Source,
  107:                       ['E', warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  108:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  109:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  110:     end,
  111:     %% Rename the output to .erl so that the compiler accepts it and
  112:     %% we won't get a warning due to the filename not matching the
  113:     %% module name.
  114:     ok = file:rename(Target, TargetSource),
  115:     case compile:file(TargetSource,
  116:                       [warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  117:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  118:         Other1 -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other1})
  119:     end,
  120:     file:delete(TargetSource),
  121:     file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  122:     ok.
  123: 
  124: %% Tests that we can compile and run a simple Erlang program,
  125: %% using compile:file/1.
  126: 
  127: file_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  129: 
  130:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  131:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  132: 
  133:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  134:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  135:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
  136: 
  137:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [slim]), %Smoke test only.
  138:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple),	%Smoke test only.
  139: 
  140:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, []),
  141:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [debug_info]),
  142:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [no_postopt]),
  143: 
  144:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [no_line_info]), %Coverage
  145:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{eprof,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  146:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_time,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  147:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_memory,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  148: 
  149:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  150:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, no_postopt),
  151: 
  152:     %% Test compiling from an .abstr file.
  153:     {ok,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr]),
  154:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(filename:rootname(Target), [from_abstr]),
  155:     ok = file:delete(filename:rootname(Target) ++ ".abstr"),
  156: 
  157:     %% Test option 'deterministic'.
  158:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [deterministic]),
  159:     {module,simple} = c:l(simple),
  160:     [{version,_}] = simple:module_info(compile),
  161:     true = code:delete(simple),
  162:     false = code:purge(simple),
  163: 
  164:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
  165:     true = exists(Target),
  166:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  167: 
  168:     %% Test option 'deterministic' as a compiler attribute.
  169:     Det = deterministic_module,
  170:     {DetPath, DetTarget} = get_files(Config, Det, "det_target"),
  171:     {ok,Det,DetCode} = compile:file(DetPath, [binary]),
  172:     {module,Det} = code:load_binary(Det, "", DetCode),
  173:     [{version,_}] = Det:module_info(compile),
  174:     true = code:delete(Det),
  175:     false = code:purge(Det),
  176: 
  177:     %% Cover error handling code.
  178:     NonExisting = definitely__no__such__module,
  179:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [report]),
  180:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_abstr,report]),
  181:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_core,report]),
  182:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_asm,report]),
  183: 
  184:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core"), [from_core,report]),
  185:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core_tokens"), [from_core,report]),
  186: 
  187:     %% Cover handling of obsolete options.
  188:     ObsoleteOptions = [r18,r19,r20,r21,r22,r23,
  189:                        no_bsm3,no_get_hd_tl,no_put_tuple2,no_utf8_atoms,
  190:                        no_swap,no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_make_fun3],
  191:     _ = [begin
  192:              {error,[{_Simple,
  193:                       [{none,compile,{obsolete_option,Opt}}]}],
  194:               []} =
  195:                  compile:file(Simple, [Opt,return]),
  196:              error = compile:file(Simple, [Opt,report])
  197:          end || Opt <- ObsoleteOptions],
  198: 
  199:     %% Create a directory with the same name as the temp file to cover
  200:     %% handling of write errors.
  201:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  202:     SimpleTempFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.bea#"),
  203:     SimpleOutputFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam"),
  204:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  205:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleOutputFile),
  206:     try
  207:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report]),
  208:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  209:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  210:     after
  211:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  212:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleOutputFile)
  213:     end,
  214: 
  215:     %% Cleanup.
  216:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  217:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  218:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(DetTarget)),
  219: 
  220:     %% There should not be any messages in the messages.
  221:     receive
  222: 	Any ->
  223: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
  224:     after 10 ->
  225: 	    ok
  226:     end,
  227: 
  228:     ok.
  229: 
  230: forms_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  232:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  233: 
  234:     Src = Simple,
  235:     AbsSrc = filename:absname(Src),
  236:     {ok,[],SimpleCode} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr,binary]),
  237: 
  238:     {ok,simple,Bin1} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [binary,{source,Src}]),
  239:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode,
  240:                                   [binary,{error_location,line},{source,Src}]),
  241: 
  242:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  243:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, no_postopt),
  244: 
  245:     %% Load and test that the proper source is returned.
  246:     AbsSrc = forms_load_code(simple, Src, Bin1),
  247: 
  248:     %% Work in a deleted directory.
  249:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  250:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  251:     ok = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  252:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  253:     case os:type() of
  254: 	{unix,_} -> os:cmd("rm -rf " ++ WorkDir);
  255: 	_ -> ok
  256:     end,
  257:     {ok,simple,Bin2} = compile:forms(SimpleCode),
  258:     undefined = forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin2),
  259: 
  260:     {ok,simple,Bin3} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [{source,Src},report]),
  261:     case forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin3) of
  262: 	Src ->					%Unix.
  263: 	    ok;
  264: 	AbsSrc ->				%Windows.
  265: 	    ok
  266:     end,
  267: 
  268:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_core0,binary]),
  269:     forms_compile_and_load(Core, [from_core]),
  270: 
  271:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_asm,binary]),
  272:     forms_compile_and_load(Asm, [from_asm]),
  273: 
  274:     %% The `from_abstr` option is redundant when compiling from forms,
  275:     %% but it should work.
  276:     forms_compile_and_load(SimpleCode, [from_abstr]),
  277: 
  278:     %% Cover the error handling code.
  279:     error = compile:forms(bad_core, [from_core,report]),
  280:     error = compile:forms(bad_asm, [from_asm,report]),
  281: 
  282:     ok.
  283: 
  284: 
  285: forms_load_code(Mod, Src, Bin) ->
  286:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Src, Bin),
  287:     Info = Mod:module_info(compile),
  288:     SourceOption = proplists:get_value(source, Info),
  289: 
  290:     %% Ensure that the options are not polluted with 'source'.
  291:     [] = proplists:get_value(options, Info),
  292: 
  293:     %% Cleanup.
  294:     true = code:delete(simple),
  295:     false = code:purge(simple),
  296: 
  297:     SourceOption.
  298: 
  299: forms_compile_and_load(Code, Opts) ->
  300:     Mod = simple,
  301:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Code, Opts),
  302:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "ignore", Bin),
  303:     _ = Mod:module_info(),
  304:     true = code:delete(simple),
  305:     false = code:purge(simple),
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: module_mismatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  309:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  310:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "wrong_module_name.erl"),
  311:     {error,[{"wrong_module_name.beam",
  312: 	     [{none,compile,{module_name,arne,"wrong_module_name"}}]}],
  313: 	   []} = compile:file(File, [return]),
  314:     error = compile:file(File, [report]),
  315: 
  316:     {ok,arne,[]} = compile:file(File,
  317: 				      [return,no_error_module_mismatch]),
  318: 
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: %% Tests that the {outdir, Dir} option works.
  322: 
  323: outdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "outdir"),
  325:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)}]),
  326:     true = exists(Target),
  327:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  328:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  329:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: %% Tests that the binary option works.
  333: 
  334: binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  335:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "binary"),
  336:     {ok, simple, Binary} = compile:file(Simple, [binary]),
  337:     code:load_binary(simple, Target, Binary),
  338:     passed = simple:test(),
  339:     true = code:delete(simple),
  340:     false = code:purge(simple),
  341:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  342:     ok.
  343: 
  344: %% Tests that the dependencies-Makefile-related options work.
  345: 
  346: makedep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  347:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  348:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  349: 
  350:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "makedep"),
  351:     SimpleRootname = filename:rootname(Simple),
  352:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  353:     IncludeOptions = [
  354: 		      {d,need_foo},
  355: 		      {d,foo_value,42},
  356: 		      {d,include_generated},
  357: 		      {i,IncludeDir}
  358: 		     ],
  359: 
  360:     %% Basic rule.
  361:     BasicMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic1.mk",
  362:     {ok,BasicMf1} = file:read_file(BasicMf1Name),
  363:     {ok,_,Mf1} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep]),
  364:     BasicMf1 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf1, DataDir),
  365: 
  366:     %% Basic rule with one existing header.
  367:     BasicMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic2.mk",
  368:     {ok,BasicMf2} = file:read_file(BasicMf2Name),
  369:     {ok,_,Mf2} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  370:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf2, DataDir),
  371: 
  372:     %% Rule with one existing header and one missing header.
  373:     MissingMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-missing.mk",
  374:     {ok,MissingMf} = file:read_file(MissingMfName),
  375:     {ok,_,Mf3} = compile:file(Simple,
  376:       [binary,makedep,makedep_add_missing|IncludeOptions]),
  377:     MissingMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf3, DataDir),
  378: 
  379:     %% Rule with modified target.
  380:     TargetMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target1.mk",
  381:     {ok,TargetMf1} = file:read_file(TargetMf1Name),
  382:     {ok,_,Mf4} = compile:file(Simple,
  383:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"}|IncludeOptions]),
  384:     TargetMf1 = makedep_modify_target(
  385:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf4, DataDir), "$$target"),
  386: 
  387:     %% Rule with quoted modified target.
  388:     TargetMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target2.mk",
  389:     {ok,TargetMf2} = file:read_file(TargetMf2Name),
  390:     {ok,_,Mf5} = compile:file(Simple,
  391:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"},makedep_quote_target|
  392:         IncludeOptions]),
  393:     TargetMf2 = makedep_modify_target(
  394:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf5, DataDir), "$$target"),
  395: 
  396:     %% Basic rule written to some file.
  397:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple,
  398:       [makedep,{makedep_output,Target}|IncludeOptions]),
  399:     {ok,Mf6} = file:read_file(Target),
  400:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf6, DataDir),
  401: 
  402:     %% Rule with creating phony target.
  403:     PhonyMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-phony.mk",
  404:     {ok,PhonyMf} = file:read_file(PhonyMfName),
  405:     {ok,_,Mf7} = compile:file(Simple,
  406:       [binary,makedep,makedep_phony|IncludeOptions]),
  407:     PhonyMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf7, DataDir),
  408: 
  409:     %% Basic rule written to the default file.
  410:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  411:     {ok,Mf8} = file:read_file(Target),
  412:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf8, DataDir),
  413: 
  414:     %% Generate dependencies and compile normally at the same time.
  415:     GeneratedHrl = filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"),
  416:     GeneratedDoc = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "foo.md"),
  417:     try
  418:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedHrl, ""),
  419:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedDoc, ""),
  420:         {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  421:                                             {makedep_output,Target},
  422:                                             {i,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  423:         {ok,Mf9} = file:read_file(Target),
  424:         BasicMf3 = iolist_to_binary([string:trim(BasicMf2), " $(srcdir)/foo.md ", filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"), "\n"]),
  425:         BasicMf3 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf9, DataDir),
  426:         error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  427:                                       {makedep_output,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions])
  428:     after
  429:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedHrl),
  430:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedDoc)
  431:     end,
  432: 
  433:     %% Cover generation of long lines that must be split.
  434:     CompileModule = filename:join(code:lib_dir(compiler), "src/compile.erl"),
  435:     {ok,_} = compile:file(CompileModule, [report,
  436:                                           makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io},
  437:                                           {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}]),
  438: 
  439:     %% Basic rule written to the standard output.
  440:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io}|IncludeOptions]),
  441: 
  442:     %% Test error handling.
  443:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,DataDir}]),
  444:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,a_bad_output_device}]),
  445: 
  446:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  447:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  448:     ok.
  449: 
  450: makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf, DataDir) ->
  451:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  452:     %% Replace the Datadir by "$(srcdir)".
  453:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, DataDir, "$(srcdir)/",
  454:       [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  455:     %% Long lines are split, put back everything on one line.
  456:     Mf2 = re:replace(Mf1, "\\\\\n  ", "", [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  457:     list_to_binary(Mf2).
  458: 
  459: makedep_modify_target(Mf, Target) ->
  460:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  461:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, Target, "$target", [{return,list}]),
  462:     list_to_binary(Mf1).
  463: 
  464: %% Tests that conditional compilation, defining values, including files work.
  465: 
  466: no_core_prepare(_Config) ->
  467:     Mod = {c_module,[],
  468:               {c_literal,[],sample_receive},
  469:               [{c_var,[],{discard,0}}],
  470:               [],
  471:               [{{c_var,[],{discard,0}},
  472:                 {c_fun,[],[],
  473:                     {c_case,[],
  474:                         {c_values,[],[]},
  475:                         [{c_clause,[],[],
  476:                              {c_literal,[],true},
  477:                              {c_receive,[],[],{c_literal,[],0},{c_literal,[],ok}}}]}}}]},
  478: 
  479:     {ok,sample_receive,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return]),
  480:     {error,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return,no_core_prepare]),
  481:     ok.
  482: 
  483: cond_and_ifdef(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  484:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "cond_and_ifdef"),
  485:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  486:     Options = [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)},
  487: 		     {d, need_foo}, {d, foo_value, 42},
  488: 		     {i, IncludeDir}, report],
  489:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, Options),
  490:     true = exists(Target),
  491:     {hiker, 42} = run(Target, foo, []),
  492:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  493:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  494:     ok.
  495: 
  496: listings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  498:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  499:     ok = do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [
  500: 	    "simple",
  501: 	    "small",
  502: 	    "small_maps"
  503: 	]),
  504: 
  505:     %% Cover handling of write errors.
  506:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  507:     SimpleTarget = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
  508:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTarget),
  509:     try
  510:         error = compile:file(Simple, ['S', {outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  511:     after
  512:         ok = file:del_dir(SimpleTarget)
  513:     end,
  514: 
  515:     ok.
  516: 
  517: do_file_listings(_, _, []) -> ok;
  518: do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [File|Files]) ->
  519:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  520:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, listings),
  521:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  522: 
  523:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  524:             {'E',".E"},
  525:             {'P',".P"},
  526:             {dpp, ".pp"},
  527:             {dabstr, ".abstr"},
  528:             {dexp, ".expand"},
  529:             {dcore, ".core"},
  530:             {doldinline, ".oldinline"},
  531:             {dinline, ".inline"},
  532:             {dcore, ".core"},
  533:             {dcopt, ".copt"},
  534:             {dcbsm, ".core_bsm"},
  535:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  536:             {dbool, ".bool"},
  537:             {dssashare, ".ssashare"},
  538:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  539:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  540:             {dcg, ".codegen"},
  541:             {dblk, ".block"},
  542:             {djmp, ".jump"},
  543:             {dclean, ".clean"},
  544:             {dopt, ".optimize"},
  545:             {diffable, ".S"}],
  546:     p_listings(List, Simple, TargetDir),
  547: 
  548:     %% Test options that produce a listing file if 'binary' is not given.
  549:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_pp, ".P"),
  550:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_exp, ".E"),
  551:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core0, ".core"),
  552:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(TargetDir, File ++ ".core")),
  553:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core, ".core"),
  554:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_dis, ".dis"),
  555: 
  556:     %% Final clean up.
  557:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  558: 	filelib:wildcard(filename:join(TargetDir, "*"))),
  559:     ok = file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  560: 
  561:     do_file_listings(DataDir,PrivDir,Files).
  562: 
  563: listings_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  564:     {Big,Target} = get_files(Config, big, listings_big),
  565:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  566:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  567:             {'E',".E"},
  568:             {'P',".P"},
  569:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  570:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  571:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  572:             {to_dis, ".dis"}],
  573:     p_listings(List, Big, TargetDir).
  574: 
  575: p_listings(List, File, BaseDir) ->
  576:     Run = fun({Option,Extension}) ->
  577:                   Uniq = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  578:                   Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, integer_to_list(Uniq)),
  579:                   ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  580:                   try
  581:                       do_listing(File, Dir, Option, Extension),
  582:                       ok
  583:                   catch
  584:                       Class:Error:Stk ->
  585:                           io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Error,Stk]),
  586:                           error
  587:                   after
  588:                       _ = [ok = file:delete(F) ||
  589:                               F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))],
  590:                       ok = file:del_dir(Dir)
  591:                   end
  592:           end,
  593:     test_lib:p_run(Run, List).
  594: 
  595: other_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  596:     {Simple,_Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "other_output"),
  597: 
  598:     io:put_chars("to_pp"),
  599:     {ok,[],PP} = compile:file(Simple, [to_pp,binary,time]),
  600:     [] = [E || E <- PP,
  601: 	       begin
  602: 		   case element(1, E) of
  603: 		       attribute -> false;
  604: 		       function -> false;
  605: 		       eof -> false
  606: 		   end
  607: 	       end],
  608: 
  609:     io:put_chars("to_exp (file)"),
  610:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:file(Simple, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  611:     true = is_list(Expand),
  612:     {attribute,_,module,simple} = lists:keyfind(module, 3, Expand),
  613:     io:put_chars("to_exp (forms)"),
  614:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:forms(PP, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  615: 
  616:     io:put_chars("to_core (file)"),
  617:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:file(Simple, [to_core,binary,time]),
  618:     c_module = element(1, Core),
  619:     {ok,_} = core_lint:module(Core),
  620:     io:put_chars("to_core (forms)"),
  621:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(PP, [to_core,binary,time]),
  622: 
  623:     io:put_chars("to_asm (file)"),
  624:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:file(Simple, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  625:     {simple,_,_,_,_} = Asm,
  626:     io:put_chars("to_asm (forms)"),
  627:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(PP, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  628: 
  629:     ok.
  630: 
  631: encrypted_abstr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  632:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "encrypted_abstr"),
  633: 
  634:     Res = case has_crypto() of
  635: 	      false ->
  636: 		  %% No crypto.
  637: 		  encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target),
  638: 		  {comment,"The crypto application is missing or broken"};
  639: 	      true ->
  640: 		  %% Simulate not having crypto by removing
  641: 		  %% the crypto application from the path.
  642: 		  OldPath = code:get_path(),
  643: 		  try
  644: 		      NewPath = OldPath -- [filename:dirname(code:which(crypto))],
  645: 		      (catch application:stop(crypto)),
  646: 		      code:delete(crypto),
  647: 		      code:purge(crypto),
  648: 		      code:set_path(NewPath),
  649: 		      encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target)
  650: 		      after
  651: 			  code:set_path(OldPath)
  652: 		      end,
  653: 
  654: 		  %% Now run the tests that require crypto.
  655: 		  encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target),
  656: 		  ok = file:delete(Target),
  657: 		  _ = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Target))
  658: 	  end,
  659:     
  660:     %% Cleanup.
  661:     Res.
  662: 
  663: encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target) ->
  664:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  665:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  666:     install_crypto_key(Key),
  667:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  668: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  669: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  670:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  671: 
  672:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  673: 				     [{debug_info_key,Key},
  674: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  675:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  676: 
  677:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  678: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{des3_cbc,Key}},
  679: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  680:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  681: 
  682:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  683: 				     [{debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}},
  684: 				      {debug_info_key,Key},
  685: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  686:     verify_abstract(Target, ?MODULE),
  687: 
  688:     {ok,{simple,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} =
  689: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
  690:     {_,Opts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
  691:     {_,'********'} = lists:keyfind(debug_info_key, 1, Opts),
  692: 
  693:     %% Try some illegal forms of crypto keys.
  694:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  695: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,"ss"}},report]),
  696:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  697: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,1,"ss"}},report]),
  698:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  699: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,42},report]),
  700: 
  701:     beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  702: 
  703:     %% Test to place the crypto file on disk. The test is dependent on the
  704:     %% $HOME of the emulator, so we do this test in another node.
  705:     TestHome = filename:join(TargetDir, "home"),
  706:     filelib:ensure_dir(TestHome),
  707:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  708:                   {win32, _} ->
  709:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  710:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  711:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  712:                   _ ->
  713:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  714:               end,
  715: 
  716:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  717: 
  718:     erpc:call(
  719:       Node,
  720:       fun() ->
  721:               ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
  722: 
  723:               error = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  724: 
  725:               CWDKey = "better use another key here",
  726:               CWDFile = ".erlang.crypt",
  727:               XDGKey = "better use yet another key here",
  728:               XDGFile = filename:join(
  729:                           filename:basedir(user_config,"erlang"),
  730:                           ".erlang.crypt"),
  731:               HOMEKey = "better use the home key here",
  732:               HOMEFile = filename:join(TestHome,".erlang.crypt"),
  733: 
  734:               write_crypt_file(CWDFile, CWDKey),
  735:               write_crypt_file(XDGFile, XDGKey),
  736:               write_crypt_file(HOMEFile, HOMEKey),
  737: 
  738:               %% First we test that .erlang.crypt in cwd works
  739:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  740:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  741:               ok = file:delete(CWDFile),
  742:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  743: 
  744:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does **not** work
  745:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  746:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  747: 
  748:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does work
  749:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  750:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  751:               ok = file:delete(HOMEFile),
  752:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  753: 
  754:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does **not** work
  755:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  756:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  757: 
  758: 
  759:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does work
  760:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  761:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  762:               ok = file:delete(XDGFile),
  763: 
  764:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  765:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  766:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code])
  767: 
  768:       end),
  769: 
  770:     peer:stop(Peer),
  771: 
  772:     %% Test key compatibility by reading a BEAM file produced before
  773:     %% the update to the new crypto functions.
  774:     install_crypto_key("an old key"),
  775:     KeyCompat = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple),
  776: 			      "key_compatibility"),
  777:     {ok,{key_compatibility,[Chunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(KeyCompat,
  778: 						       [abstract_code]),
  779:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Chunk,
  780: 
  781:     ok.
  782: 
  783: write_crypt_file(File, Key) ->
  784:     Contents = ["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"],
  785:     io:format("~s: ~s\n", [File, Contents]),
  786:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(File),
  787:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents).
  788: 
  789: encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target) ->
  790:     io:format("simpe: ~p~n", [Simple]),
  791:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  792:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  793:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  794: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  795: 				{outdir,TargetDir},report]),
  796:     ok.
  797:     
  798: verify_abstract(Beam, Backend) ->
  799:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  800:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  801:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,Backend,_}} = Dbgi.
  802: 
  803: has_crypto() ->
  804:     try
  805: 	application:start(crypto),
  806: 	application:stop(crypto),
  807: 	true
  808:     catch
  809: 	error:_ -> false
  810:     end.
  811: 
  812: install_crypto_key(Key) ->
  813:     F = fun (init) -> ok;
  814: 	    ({debug_info,des3_cbc,_,_}) -> Key;
  815: 	    (clear) -> ok
  816: 	end,
  817:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F).
  818: 
  819: %% Miscellaneous tests, mainly to get better coverage.
  820: debug_info(erlang_v1, Module, ok, _Opts) ->
  821:     {ok, [Module]};
  822: debug_info(erlang_v1, _Module, error, _Opts) ->
  823:     {error, unknown_format}.
  824: 
  825: custom_debug_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  826:     {Simple,_} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  827: 
  828:     {ok,simple,OkBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}}]), %Coverage
  829:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,[simple]}}]}} =
  830: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [abstract_code]),
  831:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,ok}}]}} =
  832: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [debug_info]),
  833: 
  834:     {ok,simple,ErrorBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,error}}]), %Coverage
  835:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} =
  836: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [abstract_code]),
  837:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,error}}]}} =
  838: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [debug_info]).
  839: 
  840: custom_compile_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  841:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  842:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,custom_compile_info}],
  843:     Opts = [binary,{compile_info,[{another,version}]}],
  844: 
  845:     {ok,custom_compile_info,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, Opts),
  846:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,CompileInfo}]}} =
  847: 	beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [compile_info]),
  848:     version = proplists:get_value(another, CompileInfo),
  849:     CompileOpts = proplists:get_value(options, CompileInfo),
  850:     undefined = proplists:get_value(compile_info, CompileOpts),
  851: 
  852:     {ok,custom_compile_info,DetBin} = compile:forms(Forms, [deterministic|Opts]),
  853:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,DetInfo}]}} =
  854: 	beam_lib:chunks(DetBin, [compile_info]),
  855:     version = proplists:get_value(another, DetInfo).
  856: 
  857: cover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     io:format("~p\n", [compile:options()]),
  859:     ok.
  860: 
  861: do_listing(Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext) ->
  862:     io:format("Source: ~p TargetDir: ~p\n  Type: ~p Ext: ~p\n",
  863: 	      [Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext]),
  864:     case compile:file(Source, [Type, time, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  865: 	{ok, _} -> ok;
  866: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  867:     end,
  868:     SourceBase = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source)),
  869: 
  870:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, SourceBase ++ Ext),
  871:     true = exists(Target).
  872: 
  873: get_files(Config, Module, OutputName) ->
  874:     code:delete(Module),
  875:     code:purge(Module),
  876:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  877:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  878:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  879:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, OutputName),
  880:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  881:     File = atom_to_list(Module) ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  882:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, File),
  883:     {Src, Target}.
  884: 
  885: run(Target, Func, Args) ->
  886:     Module = list_to_atom(filename:rootname(filename:basename(Target))),
  887:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(Target)),
  888:     Result = (catch apply(Module, Func, Args)),
  889:     true = code:delete(Module),
  890:     false = code:purge(Module),
  891:     Result.
  892: 
  893: exists(Name) ->
  894:     case file:read_file_info(Name) of
  895: 	{ok, _}    -> true;
  896: 	{error, _} -> false
  897:     end.
  898: 
  899: 
  900: strict_record(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  901:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  902:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  903:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
  904:     M = record_access,
  905:  
  906:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  907:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  908: 
  909:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  910:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  911: 
  912:     %% The option last given wins.
  913:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests,no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  914:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  915:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests,strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  916:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  917: 
  918:     %% Default (possibly influenced by ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS).
  919:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [{outdir,Priv},report_errors]),
  920:     try
  921:         {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  922:         {comment,"Default: no_strict_record_tests"}
  923:     catch
  924:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  925:             {comment,"Default: strict_record_tests"}
  926:     end.
  927: 
  928: test_strict() ->
  929:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  930:     try
  931:         record_access:test(Turtle)
  932:     catch
  933:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  934:             ok
  935:     end,
  936:     Turtle.
  937: 
  938: test_sloppy() ->
  939:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  940:     {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  941:     Turtle.
  942: 
  943: utf8_atoms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  944:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  945:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<"こんにちは"/utf8>>, utf8),
  946:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  947: 	     {function,Anno,atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,Atom}]}]}],
  948: 
  949:     Utf8AtomForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_atom}|Forms],
  950:     {ok,utf8_atom,Utf8AtomBin} =
  951: 	compile:forms(Utf8AtomForms, [binary]),
  952:     {ok,{utf8_atom,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  953: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8AtomBin, [atoms]),
  954:     code:load_binary(utf8_atom, "compile_SUITE", Utf8AtomBin),
  955:     Atom = utf8_atom:atom(),
  956:     true = is_atom(Atom),
  957:     ok.
  958: 
  959: utf8_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  960:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  961:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<"こんにちは"/utf8>>, utf8),
  962:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  963: 	     {function,Anno,Atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,world}]}]}],
  964: 
  965:     Utf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_function}|Forms],
  966:     {ok,utf8_function,Utf8FunctionBin} =
  967: 	compile:forms(Utf8FunctionForms, [binary]),
  968:     {ok,{utf8_function,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  969: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8FunctionBin, [atoms]),
  970:     code:load_binary(utf8_function, "compile_SUITE", Utf8FunctionBin),
  971:     world = utf8_function:Atom(),
  972: 
  973:     NoUtf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,no_utf8_function}|Forms],
  974:     error = compile:forms(NoUtf8FunctionForms, [binary, r19]).
  975: 
  976: extra_chunks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  977:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  978:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,extra_chunks}],
  979: 
  980:     {ok,extra_chunks,ExtraChunksBinary} =
  981: 	compile:forms(Forms, [binary, {extra_chunks, [{<<"ExCh">>, <<"Contents">>}]}]),
  982:     {ok,{extra_chunks,[{"ExCh",<<"Contents">>}]}} =
  983: 	beam_lib:chunks(ExtraChunksBinary, ["ExCh"]).
  984: 
  985: tuple_calls(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  986:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  987:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,export,[{size,1},{store,1}]},
  988: 	     {function,Anno,size,1,
  989: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  990: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,size}},
  991:                  []}]}]},
  992: 	     {function,Anno,store,1,
  993: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  994: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,store}},
  995:                  [{atom,Anno,key},{atom,Anno,value}]}]}]}],
  996: 
  997:     TupleCallsFalse = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_false}|Forms],
  998:     {ok,_,TupleCallsFalseBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsFalse, [binary]),
  999:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_false, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsFalseBinary),
 1000:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:store(dict())),
 1001:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(dict())),
 1002:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(empty_tuple())),
 1003: 
 1004:     TupleCallsTrue = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_true}|Forms],
 1005:     {ok,_,TupleCallsTrueBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsTrue, [binary,tuple_calls]),
 1006:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_true, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsTrueBinary),
 1007:     Dict = tuple_calls_true:store(dict()),
 1008:     1 = tuple_calls_true:size(Dict),
 1009:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_true:size(empty_tuple())),
 1010: 
 1011:     ok.
 1012: 
 1013: dict() ->
 1014:     dict:new().
 1015: empty_tuple() ->
 1016:     {}.
 1017: 
 1018: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1019:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, env),
 1020:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1021:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
 1022: 
 1023:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "binary"),
 1024:     try
 1025: 	env_1(Simple, Target)
 1026:     after
 1027: 	true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "ignore_me"),
 1028: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1029: 	file:delete(Target),
 1030: 	file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target))
 1031:     end,
 1032:     ok.
 1033: 
 1034: env_1(Simple, Target) ->
 1035:     %% file
 1036:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:file(Simple),
 1037:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, [debug_info]),
 1038:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, debug_info),
 1039: 
 1040:     true = exists(Target),
 1041:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,Abstr0}]}} =
 1042: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [abstract_code]),
 1043:     {raw_abstract_v1,Forms} = Abstr0,
 1044: 
 1045:     %% forms
 1046:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strong_validation"),
 1047:     {ok,simple} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1048:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, []),
 1049: 
 1050:     %% output_generated
 1051:     false = compile:output_generated([]),
 1052:     true = compile:noenv_output_generated([]),
 1053: 
 1054:     ok = file:delete(Target),
 1055: 
 1056:     %% Cover error handling.
 1057:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "'unterminated_atom"),
 1058:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1059:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", ",,,"),
 1060:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1061:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, no_postopt),
 1062: 
 1063:     ok.
 1064: 
 1065: %% Test pretty-printing in Core Erlang format and then try to
 1066: %% compile the generated Core Erlang files.
 1067: 
 1068: core_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1069:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1070:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1071:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1072: 
 1073:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1074:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
 1075: 				    {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} = 
 1076: 			     beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1077: 			 {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
 1078:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_core_pp(F, Outdir) end, Abstr).
 1079:     
 1080: do_core_pp({M,A}, Outdir) ->
 1081:     try
 1082: 	do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir)
 1083:     catch
 1084: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1085: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
 1086: 		      [Error,M]),
 1087: 	    error;
 1088: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1089: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1090: 	    error
 1091:     end.
 1092: 
 1093: do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir) ->
 1094:     {ok,M,Core0} = compile:forms(A, [to_core]),
 1095:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1096:     CorePP = core_pp:format(Core0),
 1097:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1098: 
 1099:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1100:     Core = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1101: 	       {ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1102: 	       Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1103: 	   end,
 1104:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1105: 
 1106:     %% Compile as usual (including optimizations).
 1107:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,binary]),
 1108: 
 1109:     %% Don't optimize to test that we are not dependent
 1110:     %% on the Core Erlang optimization passes.
 1111:     %% (Example of a previous bug: The core_parse pass
 1112:     %% would not turn map literals into #c_literal{}
 1113:     %% records; if sys_core_fold was run it would fix
 1114:     %% that; if sys_core_fold was not run v3_kernel would
 1115:     %% crash.)
 1116:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,no_copt,binary]),
 1117: 
 1118:     ok.
 1119: 
 1120: compile_forms(Mod, Forms, Opts) ->
 1121:     case compile:forms(Forms, [report_errors|Opts]) of
 1122: 	{ok,Mod,_} ->  ok;
 1123: 	Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1124:     end.
 1125: 
 1126: %% Pretty-print core and read it back. Should be identical.
 1127: 
 1128: core_roundtrip(Config) ->
 1129:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1130:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1131:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1132: 
 1133:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1134: 
 1135:     Test = fun(F) -> do_core_roundtrip(F, Outdir) end,
 1136:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1137:         4 ->
 1138:             %% This test case is very memory intensive. Only
 1139:             %% use a single process.
 1140:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams, 1);
 1141:         8 ->
 1142:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams)
 1143:     end.
 1144: 
 1145: do_core_roundtrip(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1146:     try
 1147: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1148: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1149: 	do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1150:     catch
 1151: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1152: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1153: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1154: 	    error;
 1155: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1156: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1157: 	    error
 1158:     end.
 1159: 
 1160: do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1161:     {ok,Mod,Core0} = compile:forms(Abstr, [to_core0]),
 1162:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core0, Outdir),
 1163: 
 1164:     %% Primarily, test that annotations are accepted for all
 1165:     %% constructs. Secondarily, smoke test cerl_trees:label/1.
 1166:     {Core1,_} = cerl_trees:label(Core0),
 1167:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core1, Outdir),
 1168: 
 1169:     %% Run the inliner to force generation of variables
 1170:     %% with numeric names.
 1171:     {ok,Mod,Core2} = compile:forms(Abstr, [inline,to_core]),
 1172:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core2, Outdir).
 1173: 
 1174: do_core_roundtrip_2(M, Core0, Outdir) ->
 1175:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1176:     CorePP = core_pp:format_all(Core0),
 1177:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1178: 
 1179:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1180:     Core2 = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,
 1181: 					 no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1182: 		{ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1183: 		Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1184: 	    end,
 1185:     Core = undo_var_translation(Core2),
 1186:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1187: 
 1188:     case cmp_core(Core0, Core, M) of
 1189: 	true -> ok;
 1190: 	false -> error
 1191:     end.
 1192: 
 1193: undo_var_translation(Tree) ->
 1194:     F = fun(Node) ->
 1195: 		case cerl:is_c_var(Node) of
 1196: 		    true ->
 1197: 			Name0 = cerl:var_name(Node),
 1198: 			try atom_to_list(Name0) of
 1199: 			    "_X"++Name ->
 1200: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1201: 			    "_"++Name ->
 1202: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1203: 			    _ ->
 1204: 				Node
 1205: 			catch
 1206: 			    error:badarg ->
 1207: 				Node
 1208: 
 1209: 			end;
 1210: 		    false ->
 1211: 			Node
 1212: 		end
 1213: 	end,
 1214:     cerl_trees:map(F, Tree).
 1215: 
 1216: cmp_core(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1217:     true;
 1218: cmp_core(M1, M2, Mod) ->
 1219:     cmp_core_fs(cerl:module_defs(M1), cerl:module_defs(M2), Mod).
 1220: 
 1221: cmp_core_fs([F1|T1], [F2|T2], Mod) ->
 1222:     cmp_core_f(F1, F2, Mod) andalso cmp_core_fs(T1, T2, Mod);
 1223: cmp_core_fs([], [], _Mod) ->
 1224:     true;
 1225: cmp_core_fs(_, _, _Mod) ->
 1226:     false.
 1227: 
 1228: cmp_core_f(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1229:     true;
 1230: cmp_core_f({Name,F1}, {Name,F2}, Mod) ->
 1231:     case diff(F1, F2) of
 1232: 	F1 ->
 1233: 	    true;
 1234: 	Diff ->
 1235: 	    io:format("~p ~p:\n~p\n", [Mod,Name,Diff]),
 1236: 	    false
 1237:     end.
 1238: 
 1239: diff(E, E) ->
 1240:     E;
 1241: diff([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
 1242:     [diff(H1, H2)|diff(T1, T2)];
 1243: diff(T1, T2) when tuple_size(T1) =:= tuple_size(T2) ->
 1244:     case cerl:is_c_var(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_var(T2) of
 1245:         true ->
 1246:             diff_var(T1, T2);
 1247:         false ->
 1248:             case cerl:is_c_map(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_map(T2) of
 1249:                 true ->
 1250:                     diff_map(T1, T2);
 1251:                 false ->
 1252:                     diff_tuple(T1, T2)
 1253:             end
 1254:     end;
 1255: diff(E1, E2) ->
 1256:     {'DIFF',E1,E2}.
 1257: 
 1258: diff_var(V1, V2) ->
 1259:     case {cerl:var_name(V1),cerl:var_name(V2)} of
 1260:         {Same,Same} ->
 1261:             V1;
 1262:         {Name1,Name2} ->
 1263:             %% The inliner uses integers as variable names. Such integers
 1264:             %% are read back as atoms.
 1265:             case is_integer(Name1) andalso
 1266:                 list_to_atom(integer_to_list(Name1)) =:= Name2 of
 1267:                 true ->
 1268:                     V1;
 1269:                 _ ->
 1270:                     cerl:update_c_var(V1, {'DIFF',Name1,Name2})
 1271:             end
 1272:     end.
 1273: 
 1274: %% Annotations for maps are not preserved exactly, but that is not
 1275: %% a real problem. Workaround by not comparing all annotations when
 1276: %% comparing maps.
 1277: 
 1278: diff_map(M, M) ->
 1279:     M;
 1280: diff_map(M1, M2) ->
 1281:     case cerl:get_ann(M1) =:= cerl:get_ann(M2) of
 1282:         false ->
 1283:             diff_tuple(M1, M2);
 1284:         true ->
 1285:             case remove_compiler_gen(M1) =:= remove_compiler_gen(M2) of
 1286:                 true ->
 1287:                     M1;
 1288:                 false ->
 1289:                     diff_tuple(M1, M2)
 1290:             end
 1291:     end.
 1292: 
 1293: diff_tuple(T1, T2) ->
 1294:     L = diff(tuple_to_list(T1), tuple_to_list(T2)),
 1295:     list_to_tuple(L).
 1296: 
 1297: remove_compiler_gen(M) ->
 1298:     Arg0 = cerl:map_arg(M),
 1299:     Arg = cerl:set_ann(Arg0, []),
 1300:     Es0 = cerl:map_es(M),
 1301:     Es = [remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) || Pair <- Es0],
 1302:     cerl:update_c_map(M, Arg, Es).
 1303: 
 1304: remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) ->
 1305:     Op0 = cerl:map_pair_op(Pair),
 1306:     Op = cerl:set_ann(Op0, []),
 1307:     K = map_var(cerl:map_pair_key(Pair)),
 1308:     V = map_var(cerl:map_pair_val(Pair)),
 1309:     cerl:update_c_map_pair(Pair, Op, K, V).
 1310: 
 1311: map_var(Var) ->
 1312:     case cerl:is_c_var(Var) of
 1313:         true ->
 1314:             case cerl:var_name(Var) of
 1315:                 Name when is_atom(Name) ->
 1316:                     L = atom_to_list(Name),
 1317:                     try list_to_integer(L) of
 1318:                         Int ->
 1319:                             cerl:update_c_var(Var, Int)
 1320:                     catch
 1321:                         error:_ ->
 1322:                             Var
 1323:                     end;
 1324:                 _ ->
 1325:                     Var
 1326:             end;
 1327:         false ->
 1328:             Var
 1329:     end.
 1330: 
 1331: %% Compile to Beam assembly language (.S) and then try to
 1332: %% run .S through the compiler again.
 1333: 
 1334: asm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1335:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1336:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm"),
 1337:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1338: 
 1339:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1340:     Res = test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_asm(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams),
 1341:     Res.
 1342: 
 1343:     
 1344: do_asm(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1345:     {ok,{M,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,A}}]}} =
 1346: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1347:     try
 1348:         Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(M),
 1349: 	{ok,M,Asm} = compile:forms(A, ['S'|Opts]),
 1350: 	AsmFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".S"),
 1351: 	{ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1352: 	beam_listing:module(Fd, Asm),
 1353: 	ok = file:close(Fd),
 1354:         case compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,binary,report|Opts]) of
 1355: 	    {ok,M,_} ->
 1356: 		ok = file:delete(AsmFile);
 1357: 	    Other ->
 1358: 		io:format("*** failure '~p' for ~s\n",
 1359: 			  [Other,AsmFile]),
 1360: 		error
 1361: 	end
 1362:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
 1363: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1364: 	    error
 1365:     end.
 1366: 
 1367: %% Compile a crafted file which produces the three call instructions
 1368: %% which should have a comment with the called function in clear
 1369: %% text. We check that the expected functions and comments occur in
 1370: %% the listing.
 1371: 
 1372: asm_labels(Config) ->
 1373:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1374:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1375:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "asm_labels.erl"),
 1376:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm_labels"),
 1377:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "asm_labels.S"),
 1378:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 1379:     {ok,asm_labels} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 1380:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 1381:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 1382:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1383:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_only,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1384:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_last,.+,{f,.+},.+}\\. % bar/1)", Os),
 1385:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 1386: 
 1387: sys_pre_attributes(Config) ->
 1388:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1389:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "attributes.erl"),
 1390:     Mod = attributes,
 1391:     CommonOpts = [binary,report,verbose,
 1392: 		  {parse_transform,sys_pre_attributes}],
 1393:     PreOpts = [{attribute,delete,deleted}],
 1394:     PostOpts = [{attribute,insert,inserted,"value"}],
 1395:     PrePostOpts = [{attribute,replace,replaced,42},
 1396: 		   {attribute,replace,replace_nonexisting,new}],
 1397:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1398: 				     PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1399:     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Code),
 1400:     Attr = Mod:module_info(attributes),
 1401:     io:format("~p", [Attr]),
 1402:     {inserted,"value"} = lists:keyfind(inserted, 1, Attr),
 1403:     {replaced,[42]} = lists:keyfind(replaced, 1, Attr),
 1404:     {replace_nonexisting,[new]} = lists:keyfind(replace_nonexisting, 1, Attr),
 1405:     false = lists:keymember(deleted, 1, Attr),
 1406: 
 1407:     %% Cover more code.
 1408:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1409:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, CommonOpts -- [verbose]),
 1410:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PreOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1411:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File,
 1412: 			      [{attribute,replace,replaced,42}|CommonOpts]),
 1413:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1414: 				  PostOpts ++ CommonOpts --
 1415: 				  [report,verbose]),
 1416:     ok.
 1417: 
 1418: %% Test the dialyzer option to cover more code.
 1419: dialyzer(Config) ->
 1420:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1421:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1422:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
 1423:     M = dialyzer_test,
 1424:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [dialyzer|Opts]),
 1425:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1426: 
 1427:     %% Cover huge line numbers without the 'dialyzer' option.
 1428:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
 1429:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1430:     ok.
 1431: 
 1432: beam_ssa_pp_smoke_test(Config) ->
 1433:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1434:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1435:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1436:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1437:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> beam_ssa_pp(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams).
 1438: 
 1439: beam_ssa_pp(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1440:     try
 1441: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1442: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1443: 	beam_ssa_pp_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1444:     catch
 1445: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1446: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1447: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1448: 	    error;
 1449: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1450: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1451: 	    error
 1452:     end.
 1453: 
 1454: beam_ssa_pp_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1455:     Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(Mod),
 1456:     {ok,Mod,SSA} = compile:forms(Abstr, [dssaopt|Opts]),
 1457:     ListFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".ssaopt"),
 1458:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(ListFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1459:     beam_listing:module(Fd, SSA),
 1460:     ok = file:close(Fd).
 1461: 
 1462: %% Test that warnings contain filenames and line numbers.
 1463: warnings(_Config) ->
 1464:     Files = get_unique_files(".erl"),
 1465:     test_lib:p_run(fun do_warnings/1, Files).
 1466: 
 1467: do_warnings(F) ->
 1468:     Options = [{feature,maybe_expr,enable},binary,bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info,return],
 1469:     {ok,_,_,Ws} = compile:file(F, Options),
 1470:     do_warnings_1(Ws, F).
 1471: 
 1472: do_warnings_1([{"no_file",Ws}|_], F) ->
 1473:     io:format("~s:\nMissing file for warnings: ~p\n",
 1474: 	      [F,Ws]),
 1475:     error;
 1476: do_warnings_1([{Name,Ws}|T], F) ->
 1477:     case filename:extension(Name) of
 1478: 	".erl" ->
 1479: 	    do_warnings_2(Ws, T, F);
 1480: 	_ ->
 1481: 	    io:format("~s:\nNo .erl extension\n", [F]),
 1482: 	    error
 1483:     end;
 1484: do_warnings_1([], _) -> ok.
 1485: 
 1486: do_warnings_2([{Pos,_,_}=W|T], Next, F) ->
 1487:     case Pos of
 1488: 	Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1489: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1490: 	{Line,Col} when is_integer(Line), is_integer(Col) ->
 1491: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1492: 	true ->
 1493: 	    io:format("~s:\nMissing line number: ~p\n",
 1494: 		      [F,W]),
 1495: 	    error
 1496:     end;
 1497: do_warnings_2([], Next, F) ->
 1498:     do_warnings_1(Next, F).
 1499: 
 1500: message_printing(Config) ->
 1501:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1502:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1503: 
 1504:     BadEncFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_enc.erl"),
 1505:     {error,BadEncErrors, []} = compile:file(BadEncFile, [return]),
 1506: 
 1507:     [":7:15: cannot parse file, giving up\n"
 1508:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1509:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1510:     ,
 1511:      ":7:15: cannot translate from UTF-8\n"
 1512:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1513:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1514:     ] = messages(BadEncErrors),
 1515: 
 1516:     UTF8File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_utf8.erl"),
 1517:     {ok,_,UTF8Errors} = compile:file(UTF8File, [return]),
 1518:     [":5:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1519:      "%    5|     B = <<\"xyzåäö\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1520:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1521:     ] = messages(UTF8Errors),
 1522: 
 1523:     Latin1File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_lat1.erl"),
 1524:     {ok,_,Latin1Errors} = compile:file(Latin1File, [return]),
 1525:     [":6:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1526:      "%    6|     B = <<\"xyzåäö\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1527:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1528:     ] = messages(Latin1Errors),
 1529: 
 1530:     LongFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "long.erl"),
 1531:     Long = ["-module(long).\n",
 1532:             "-export([foo/0]).\n",
 1533:             "unused() -> ok.\n",
 1534:             lists:duplicate(10000, $\n),
 1535:             "foo() -> bar().\n"],
 1536:     ok = file:write_file(LongFile, Long),
 1537:     {error,LongErrors,LongWarnings} = compile:file(LongFile, [return]),
 1538:     [":10004:10: function bar/0 undefined\n"
 1539:      "% 10004| foo() -> bar().\n"
 1540:      "%      |          ^\n\n"
 1541:     ] = messages(LongErrors),
 1542:     [":3:1: function unused/0 is unused\n"
 1543:      "%    3| unused() -> ok.\n"
 1544:      "%     | ^\n\n"
 1545:     ] = messages(LongWarnings),
 1546:     ok = file:delete(LongFile),
 1547: 
 1548:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1549:     try
 1550:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1551:         {ok,cover_messages,_} = compile:file(cover_messages, [report, binary])
 1552:     after
 1553:         file:set_cwd(OldCwd)
 1554:     end,
 1555: 
 1556:     ok.
 1557: 
 1558: messages(Errors) ->
 1559:     lists:flatmap(fun ({{File,_L},Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs);
 1560:                       ({File,Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs)
 1561:                   end,
 1562:                   Errors).
 1563: 
 1564: format_descs(File, Descs) ->
 1565:     [strip_prefix(File, lists:flatten(Text))
 1566:      || {_Where, Text} <- sys_messages:format_messages(File, "", Descs, [])].
 1567: 
 1568: strip_prefix(Prefix, String) ->
 1569:     case string:prefix(String, Prefix) of
 1570:         nomatch -> String;
 1571:         Rest -> Rest
 1572:     end.
 1573: 
 1574: %% Test that the compile:pre_load/0 function (used by 'erlc')
 1575: %% pre-loads the modules that are used by a typical compilation.
 1576: 
 1577: pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1578:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1579:         true ->
 1580:             {skip,"Cover is running"};
 1581:         false ->
 1582:             try
 1583:                 do_pre_load_check(Config)
 1584:             after
 1585:                 dbg:stop()
 1586:             end
 1587:     end.
 1588: 
 1589: do_pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1590:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 1591:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1592:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big.erl"),
 1593:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun pre_load_trace/2,[]}),
 1594:     dbg:p(self(), call),
 1595:     dbg:p(new, call),
 1596:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl({?MODULE,get_trace_data,0}, []),
 1597:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}, []),
 1598: 
 1599:     %% Compile a simple module using the erl_compile interface
 1600:     %% to find out the modules that are pre-loaded by
 1601:     %% compile:pre_load/0.
 1602:     Opts = #options{specific=[binary]},
 1603:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "", Opts),
 1604:     [{code,ensure_modules_loaded,[PreLoaded0]}] = get_trace_data(),
 1605:     PreLoaded1 = ordsets:from_list(PreLoaded0),
 1606: 
 1607:     %% Since 'compile' is the function doing the pre-loaded,
 1608:     %% it is useless to include it in the list.
 1609:     case ordsets:is_element(compile, PreLoaded1) of
 1610: 	true ->
 1611: 	    io:put_chars("The 'compile' module should not be included "
 1612: 			 "in the list of modules to be pre-loaded."),
 1613: 	    ct:fail(compile);
 1614: 	false ->
 1615: 	    []
 1616:     end,
 1617:     PreLoaded = ordsets:add_element(compile, PreLoaded1),
 1618: 
 1619:     %% Now unload all pre-loaded modules and all modules in
 1620:     %% compiler application. Then compile a module to find
 1621:     %% which modules that get loaded.
 1622:     CompilerMods = compiler_modules(),
 1623:     Unload = ordsets:union(ordsets:from_list(CompilerMods), PreLoaded),
 1624:     _ = [begin
 1625: 	     code:delete(M),
 1626: 	     code:purge(M)
 1627: 	 end || M <- Unload],
 1628: 
 1629:     {ok,_} = dbg:ctp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}),
 1630:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_loaded,1}, []),
 1631:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary]),
 1632:     WasLoaded0 = get_trace_data(),
 1633:     WasLoaded1 = [M || {code,ensure_loaded,[M]} <- WasLoaded0],
 1634:     WasLoaded = ordsets:from_list(WasLoaded1),
 1635: 
 1636:     %% Check for modules that should have been pre-loaded.
 1637:     case ordsets:subtract(WasLoaded, PreLoaded) of
 1638: 	[] ->
 1639: 	    ok;
 1640: 	[_|_]=NotPreLoaded ->
 1641: 	    io:format("The following modules were used "
 1642: 		      "but not pre-loaded:\n~p\n",
 1643: 		      [NotPreLoaded]),
 1644: 	    ct:fail({not_preload,NotPreLoaded})
 1645:     end,
 1646: 
 1647:     %% Check for modules that should not be pre-loaded.
 1648:     case ordsets:subtract(PreLoaded, WasLoaded) of
 1649: 	[] ->
 1650: 	    ok;
 1651: 	[_|_]=NotUsed ->
 1652: 	    io:format("The following modules were pre-loaded"
 1653: 		      " but not used:\n~p\n",
 1654: 		      [NotUsed]),
 1655: 	    ct:fail({not_used,NotUsed})
 1656:     end,
 1657: 
 1658:     ok.
 1659: 
 1660: get_trace_data() ->
 1661:     %% Apparantely, doing a receive at the beginning of
 1662:     %% a traced function can cause extra trace messages.
 1663:     %% To avoid that, don't do the receive in this function.
 1664:     do_get_trace_data().
 1665: 
 1666: do_get_trace_data() ->
 1667:     receive
 1668: 	{trace_data,Data} -> Data
 1669:     end.
 1670: 
 1671: pre_load_trace({trace,Pid,call,{?MODULE,get_trace_data,[]}}, Acc) ->
 1672:     Pid ! {trace_data,Acc},
 1673:     [];
 1674: pre_load_trace({trace,_,call,MFA}, Acc) ->
 1675:     [MFA|Acc].
 1676: 
 1677: compiler_modules() ->
 1678:     Wc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler),"ebin","*.beam"]),
 1679:     Ms = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 1680:     FN = filename,
 1681:     [list_to_atom(FN:rootname(FN:basename(M), ".beam")) || M <- Ms].
 1682: 
 1683: %% Test that ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS are correctly retrieved
 1684: %% by env_compiler_options/0
 1685: 
 1686: env_compiler_options(_Config) ->
 1687:     Cases = [
 1688:         {"bin_opt_info", [bin_opt_info]},
 1689:         {"recv_opt_info", [recv_opt_info]},
 1690:         {"'S'", ['S']},
 1691:         {"{source, \"test.erl\"}", [{source, "test.erl"}]},
 1692:         {"[{d,macro_one,1},{d,macro_two}]", [{d, macro_one, 1}, {d, macro_two}]},
 1693:         {"[warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]", [warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]}
 1694:     ],
 1695:     F = fun({Env, Expected}) ->
 1696:         true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", Env),
 1697:         Expected = compile:env_compiler_options()
 1698:     end,
 1699:     lists:foreach(F, Cases).
 1700: 
 1701: %% Test options for compatibility with previous major versions of OTP.
 1702: 
 1703: bc_options(Config) ->
 1704:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1705: 
 1706:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1707: 
 1708:     L = [{171, small_float, [no_line_info,
 1709:                              no_ssa_opt_float,
 1710:                              no_type_opt]},
 1711:          {171, small_float, [no_line_info]},
 1712:          {171, small_float, []},
 1713:          {171, small_float, [r24]},
 1714:          {171, small_float, [r25]},
 1715: 
 1716:          {172, small, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1717:                        no_ssa_opt_float,
 1718:                        no_line_info,
 1719:                        no_type_opt,
 1720:                        no_bs_match]},
 1721:          {172, small, [r24]},
 1722: 
 1723:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1724:                       no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1725:                       no_type_opt]},
 1726:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1727:                       no_line_info,
 1728:                       no_stack_trimming,
 1729:                       no_type_opt]},
 1730:          {172, funs, [r24]},
 1731: 
 1732:          {172, small_maps, [r24]},
 1733:          {172, small_maps, [no_type_opt]},
 1734: 
 1735:          {172, big, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1736:                      no_ssa_opt_float,
 1737:                      no_line_info,
 1738:                      no_type_opt]},
 1739:          {172, big, [r24]},
 1740: 
 1741:          {178, small, [r25]},
 1742:          {178, big, [r25]},
 1743:          {178, funs, []},
 1744:          {178, big, []}
 1745:         ],
 1746: 
 1747:     Test = fun({Expected,Mod,Options}) ->
 1748:                    case highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Options) of
 1749:                        Expected ->
 1750:                            ok;
 1751:                        Got ->
 1752:                            io:format("*** module ~p, options ~p => got ~p; expected ~p\n",
 1753:                                      [Mod,Options,Got,Expected]),
 1754:                            error
 1755:                    end
 1756:            end,
 1757:     test_lib:p_run(Test, L),
 1758:     ok.
 1759: 
 1760: highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Opt) ->
 1761:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
 1762:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Src, [binary,report_errors|Opt]),
 1763:     test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam).
 1764: 
 1765: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1766:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1767:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1768:  
 1769:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if their include paths do,
 1770:     %% as their debug info will be different.
 1771:     {ok,_,NonDetA} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1772:     {ok,_,NonDetB} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1773:     true = NonDetA =/= NonDetB,
 1774: 
 1775:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1776:     {ok,_,DetC} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1777:     {ok,_,DetD} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1778:     true = DetC =:= DetD,
 1779: 
 1780:     ok.
 1781: 
 1782: deterministic_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1783:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1784: 
 1785:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if they were compiled from a
 1786:     %% different directory.
 1787:     true = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", []),
 1788: 
 1789:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1790:     false = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", [deterministic]),
 1791: 
 1792:     ok.
 1793: 
 1794: deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1795:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1796:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1797:     try
 1798:         {ok,_,A} = compile:file(Simple, [binary | Opts]),
 1799:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1800:         {ok,_,B} = compile:file(Name, [binary | Opts]),
 1801:         A =/= B
 1802:     after
 1803:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1804:     end.
 1805: 
 1806: %% ERL-1058: -compile(debug_info) had no effect
 1807: compile_attribute(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1808:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1809: 
 1810:     %% The test module has a -compile([debug_info]). attribute, which means
 1811:     %% debug information should always be included.
 1812:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", [debug_info]),
 1813:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", []),
 1814: 
 1815:     ok.
 1816: 
 1817: debug_info_attribute(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1818:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
 1819:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary | Opts]),
 1820:     {ok, {_, Attrs}} = beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [debug_info]),
 1821: 
 1822:     [{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code, {Forms, _}}}] = Attrs,
 1823:     [{attribute,{1,1},file,{_,1}},
 1824:      {attribute,{1,2},module,debug_info},
 1825:      {attribute,{2,2},compile,[debug_info]},
 1826:      {eof,_}] = forms_to_terms(Forms),
 1827: 
 1828:     ok.
 1829: 
 1830: forms_to_terms(Forms) ->
 1831:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 1832: 
 1833: %% Test compiler options not tested in other test cases.
 1834: other_options(Config) ->
 1835:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1836: 
 1837:     %% Smoke test of no_spawn_compiler_process, brief, and absolute_source
 1838:     %% options.
 1839:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1840:     {ok,big,<<_/binary>>} =
 1841:         compile:file(Big, [binary,
 1842:                            no_spawn_compiler_process,
 1843:                            brief,
 1844:                            absolute_source,
 1845:                            report]),
 1846: 
 1847:     %% Test generating a compressed BEAM file. Also cover the redundant
 1848:     %% `beam` option and the `no_inline` option.
 1849:     Small = filename:join(DataDir, "small"),
 1850:     {ok,small} = compile:file(Small, [report, no_inline, compressed, beam]),
 1851: 
 1852:     ok.
 1853: 
 1854: %% Test core transforms and parse transforms.
 1855: transforms(Config) ->
 1856:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1857:     try
 1858:         do_transforms(Config)
 1859:     after
 1860:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1861:     end.
 1862: 
 1863: do_transforms(Config) ->
 1864:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1865:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1866:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1867:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1868:     ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
 1869: 
 1870:     %% Compile our parse transforms.
 1871:     LinePt = filename:join(DataDir, "line_pt"),
 1872:     {ok,line_pt} = compile:file(LinePt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1873:     ColumnPt = filename:join(DataDir, "column_pt"),
 1874:     {ok,column_pt} = compile:file(ColumnPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1875:     GenericPt = filename:join(DataDir, "generic_pt"),
 1876:     {ok,generic_pt} = compile:file(GenericPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1877: 
 1878:     %% Compile a file using line_pt and verify that column numbers
 1879:     %% have been stripped.
 1880:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1881:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1882: 
 1883:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and verify that column numbers
 1884:     %% have NOT been stripped.
 1885:     {[_|_],[]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1886: 
 1887:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and error_location=line and verify
 1888:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1889:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1890:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1891: 
 1892:     %% Compile a file using column_pt, line_pt and verify
 1893:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1894:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt},
 1895:                                                   {parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1896: 
 1897:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1898:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1899:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1900:                                                   add_columns,
 1901:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1902: 
 1903:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1904:     %% then call column_pt again to check that columns are stripped in between calls.
 1905:     %% and then verify that column numbers have been stripped from output.
 1906:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1907:                                                   add_columns,
 1908:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt},
 1909:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1910: 
 1911:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and en error and error_location=line and
 1912:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1913:     {error,[{_What,[{Line,_,_}]}],[_|_]} =
 1914:         compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1915:                                          add_columns,
 1916:                                          add_error,
 1917:                                          {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1918:     true = is_integer(Line),
 1919: 
 1920:     %% Cover transform code implementing the `time` option.
 1921:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary, time, report,
 1922:                                     {core_transform,generic_pt},
