 1923:                                     {parse_transform,generic_pt}]),
 1924: 
 1925:     %% Test exceptions from a core transform.
 1926:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, simple),
 1927:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1928:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1929: 
 1930:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1931:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1932: 
 1933:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1934:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1935: 
 1936:     %% Test exceptions from a parse transform.
 1937:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1938:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1939: 
 1940:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1941:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1942: 
 1943:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1944:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1945: 
 1946:     %% Test generating errors and warnings in a parse_transform.
 1947:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1948:     {ok,simple,[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1949:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, error}]),
 1950:     {error,[_|_],[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, error}]),
 1951:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, undefined_error}]),
 1952:     {error,[_|_],[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, undefined_error}]),
 1953: 
 1954:     ok.
 1955: 
 1956: compile_partition_warnings(Source, Opts) ->
 1957:     case compile:file(Source, [binary, return | Opts]) of
 1958:         {ok,big,<<_/binary>>,Ws0} ->
 1959:             [{_SourcePath,Ws}] = Ws0,
 1960: 
 1961:             %% Return {[ColumnWarning], [LineWarning]}.
 1962:             lists:partition(fun({{L,C},_,_}) when is_integer(L), is_integer(C) -> true;
 1963:                                ({L,_,_}) when is_integer(L) -> false
 1964:                             end, Ws);
 1965:         Error ->
 1966:             Error
 1967:     end.
 1968: 
 1969: %% Cover the erl_compile API used by erlc.
 1970: erl_compile_api(Config) ->
 1971:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1972:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1973:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1974: 
 1975:     Opts = #options{outdir=PrivDir},
 1976:     BinOpts = Opts#options{specific=[binary]},
 1977: 
 1978:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts),
 1979:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{cwd=PrivDir,includes=[PrivDir]}),
 1980:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1981: 
 1982:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[dabstr]}),
 1983:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[to_core]}),
 1984:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[to_asm]}),
 1985: 
 1986:     SimpleAbstr = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.abstr"),
 1987:     SimpleCore = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.core"),
 1988:     SimpleAsm = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
 1989: 
 1990:     ok = compile:compile_abstr(SimpleAbstr, "ignored", Opts),
 1991:     ok = compile:compile_core(SimpleCore, "ignored", Opts),
 1992:     ok = compile:compile_asm(SimpleAsm, "ignored", Opts),
 1993: 
 1994:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_abstr(SimpleAbstr, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1995:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_core(SimpleCore, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1996:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_asm(SimpleAsm, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1997: 
 1998:     NeedsDefines = filename:join(DataDir, "needs_defines.erl"),
 1999:     ok = compile:compile(NeedsDefines, "ignored", Opts#options{defines=[compile_this,{'TEST_RESULT',whatever}]}),
 2000: 
 2001:     ok = file:delete(SimpleAbstr),
 2002:     ok = file:delete(SimpleCore),
 2003:     ok = file:delete(SimpleAsm),
 2004:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam")),
 2005:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, "needs_defines.beam")),
 2006: 
 2007:     ok.
 2008: 
 2009: %% Check that an ssa dump contains the pretty printed types we expect.
 2010: %% The module we compile and dump, types_pp, is crafted so it contains
 2011: %% calls to functions which have the result types we want to check the
 2012: %% pretty printer for. We check all types except for bs_context,
 2013: %% bs_matchable and the interval form of float as the first two never
 2014: %% seem to appear in result types and the latter doesn't appear in any
 2015: %% module compiled by diffable.
 2016: types_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2017:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2018:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2019:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, types_pp),
 2020:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "types_pp.erl"),
 2021:     Listing = filename:join(TargetDir, "types_pp.ssaopt"),
 2022:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 2023: 
 2024:     {ok,_} = compile:file(File, [dssaopt, {outdir, TargetDir}]),
 2025:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(Listing),
 2026:     Lines = string:split(binary_to_list(Data), "\n", all),
 2027:     ResultTypes = get_result_types(Lines),
 2028:     io:format("Calls: ~p~n", [ResultTypes]),
 2029: 
 2030:     TypesToCheck = [{make_atom, "'an_atom'"},
 2031:                     {make_number, "number()"},
 2032:                     {make_float, "3.14"},
 2033:                     {make_integer, "17"},
 2034:                     {make_integer_range, "0..3"},
 2035:                     {make_nil, "nil()"},
 2036:                     {make_list, "list(any())"},
 2037:                     {make_list_of_ints, "list(integer())"},
 2038:                     {make_maybe_improper_list,
 2039:                      "maybe_improper_list(any(), any())"},
 2040:                     {make_nonempty_list, "nonempty_list(any())"},
 2041:                     {make_nonempty_improper_list,
 2042:                      "nonempty_improper_list(any(), ''end'')"},
 2043:                     {make_empty_map, "#{}"},
 2044:                     {make_map, "map()"},
 2045:                     {make_map_known_types, "#{integer()=>float()}"},
 2046:                     {make_fun_unknown_arity_known_type,
 2047:                      "fun((...) -> number())"},
 2048:                     {make_fun_known_arity_known_type,
 2049:                      "fun((_, _) -> number())"},
 2050:                     {make_fun_unknown_arity_unknown_type,
 2051:                      "fun()"},
 2052:                     {make_fun_known_arity_unknown_type,
 2053:                      "fun((_, _))"},
 2054:                     {make_unconstrained_tuple, "{...}"},
 2055:                     {make_known_size_tuple,
 2056:                      "{any(), any(), any(), any(), any()}"},
 2057:                     {make_inexact_tuple, "{any(), any(), any(), ...}"},
 2058:                     {make_union,
 2059:                      "'foo' | nonempty_list(1..3) | number(3, 7) |"
 2060:                      " {'tag0', 1, 2} | {'tag1', 3, 4} | bitstring(8)"},
 2061:                     {make_bitstring, "bitstring(8)"},
 2062:                     {make_none, "none()"}],
 2063:     lists:foreach(fun({FunName, Expected}) ->
 2064:                           Actual = map_get(atom_to_list(FunName), ResultTypes),
 2065:                           case Actual of
 2066:                               Expected ->
 2067:                                   ok;
 2068:                               _ ->
 2069:                                   ct:fail("Expected type of ~p is ~s, found ~s",
 2070:                                           [FunName, Expected, Actual])
 2071:                           end
 2072:                   end, TypesToCheck),
 2073:     ok = file:del_dir_r(TargetDir),
 2074:     ok.
 2075: 
 2076: %% Parsing for result types. Remember the last seen "Result type"
 2077: %% annotation and apply it to calls when we see them to a call when we
 2078: %% see them.
 2079: get_result_types(Lines) ->
 2080:     get_result_types(Lines, none, #{}).
 2081: 
 2082: get_result_types(["  %% Result type:"++_,"  %%    "++TypeLine|Lines], _, Acc) ->
 2083:     get_result_types(Lines, TypeLine, Acc);
 2084: get_result_types([Line|Lines], TypeLine, Acc0) ->
 2085:     Split = string:split(Line, "="),
 2086:     Acc = case Split of
 2087:               [_, " call" ++ Rest] ->
 2088:                   case string:split(Rest, "`", all) of
 2089:                       [_,Callee,_] ->
 2090:                           Acc0#{ Callee => TypeLine };
 2091:                       _ ->
 2092:                           Acc0
 2093:                   end;
 2094:               _ ->
 2095:                   Acc0
 2096:           end,
 2097:     get_result_types(Lines, TypeLine, Acc);
 2098: get_result_types([], _, Acc) ->
 2099:     Acc.
 2100: 
 2101: %% Check that the beam_ssa_type pass knows about bs_init_writable.
 2102: bs_init_writable(Config) ->
 2103:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2104:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2105:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bs_init_writable.erl"),
 2106:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bs_init_writable"),
 2107:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "bs_init_writable.S"),
 2108:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 2109:     {ok,bs_init_writable} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 2110:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 2111:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 2112:     %% The is_bitstr test should be optimized away.
 2113:     nomatch = re:run(Listing, "({test,is_bitstr,.+})", Os),
 2114:     %% The is_bitstr test should be optimized away.
 2115:     nomatch = re:run(Listing, "({test,is_binary,.+})", Os),
 2116:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 2117: 
 2118: 
 2119: %% Check that an SSA listing contains pretty printed annotations, this
 2120: %% blindly checks that the expected annotation occurs the expected
 2121: %% number of times. Checking that the annotations are correctly placed
 2122: %% and contains the correct information is done in
 2123: %% beam_ssa_check_SUITE.
 2124: annotations_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2125:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2126:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2127:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, types_pp),
 2128:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "annotations_pp.erl"),
 2129:     Listing = filename:join(TargetDir, "annotations_pp.ssaopt"),
 2130:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 2131: 
 2132:     {ok,_} = compile:file(File, [dssaopt, {outdir, TargetDir}]),
 2133:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(Listing),
 2134:     Lines = string:split(binary_to_list(Data), "\n", all),
 2135: 
 2136:     ResultTypes = get_annotations("  %% Result type:", Lines),
 2137:     10 = length(ResultTypes),
 2138: 
 2139:     Uniques = get_annotations("  %% Unique:", Lines),
 2140:     10 = length(Uniques),
 2141: 
 2142:     Aliased = get_annotations("  %% Aliased:", Lines),
 2143:     13 = length(Aliased),
 2144: 
 2145:     ok = file:del_dir_r(TargetDir),
 2146:     ok.
 2147: 
 2148: get_annotations(Key, [Key,"  %%    "++Anno|Lines]) ->
 2149:     [Anno|get_annotations(Key, Lines)];
 2150: get_annotations(Key, [_|Lines]) ->
 2151:     get_annotations(Key, Lines);
 2152: get_annotations(_, []) ->
 2153:     [].
 2154: 
 2155: option_order(Config) ->
 2156:     Ts = [{spec1,
 2157:            ~"""
 2158:             -compile(nowarn_missing_spec).
 2159:             foo() -> ok.
 2160:             """,
 2161:            [],                                  %Environment
 2162:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2163:            []},
 2164:           {spec2,
 2165:            ~"""
 2166:             foo() -> ok.
 2167:             """,
 2168:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "warn_missing_spec"}],
 2169:            [nowarn_missing_spec],
 2170:            []},
 2171:           {spec3,
 2172:            ~"""
 2173:             -compile(nowarn_missing_spec).
 2174:             foo() -> ok.
 2175:             """,
 2176:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2177:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2178:            []},
 2179:           {spec4,
 2180:            ~"""
 2181:             -compile(warn_missing_spec).
 2182:             foo() -> ok.
 2183:             """,
 2184:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2185:            [],
 2186:            {warnings,[{{2,1},erl_lint,{missing_spec,{foo,0}}}]}
 2187:           },
 2188:           {spec5,
 2189:            ~"""
 2190:             -compile([warn_missing_spec,nowarn_missing_spec]).
 2191:             foo() -> ok.
 2192:             """,
 2193:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2194:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2195:            []},
 2196:           {records1,
 2197:            ~"""
 2198:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2199:             rec_test(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> X + Y.
 2200:             """,
 2201:            [],
 2202:            [strict_record_tests],
 2203:            fun(M) ->
 2204:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2205:                        3 ->
 2206:                            fail()
 2207:                    catch
 2208:                        error:function_clause ->
 2209:                            ok
 2210:                    end
 2211:            end},
 2212:           {records2,
 2213:            ~"""
 2214:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2215:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2216:             """,
 2217:            [],
 2218:            [no_strict_record_tests],
 2219:            fun(M) ->
 2220:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2221:                    ok
 2222:            end},
 2223:           {records3,
 2224:            ~"""
 2225:             -compile(no_strict_record_tests).
 2226:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2227:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2228:             """,
 2229:            [],
 2230:            [strict_record_tests],
 2231:            fun(M) ->
 2232:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2233:                    ok
 2234:            end},
 2235:           {records4,
 2236:            ~"""
 2237:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2238:             rec_test(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> X + Y.
 2239:             """,
 2240:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2241:            [],
 2242:            fun(M) ->
 2243:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2244:                        3 ->
 2245:                            fail()
 2246:                    catch
 2247:                        error:function_clause ->
 2248:                            ok
 2249:                    end
 2250:            end},
 2251:           {records5,
 2252:            ~"""
 2253:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2254:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2255:             """,
 2256:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2257:            [no_strict_record_tests],
 2258:            fun(M) ->
 2259:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2260:                    ok
 2261:            end},
 2262:           {records6,
 2263:            ~"""
 2264:             -compile(no_strict_record_tests).
 2265:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2266:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2267:             """,
 2268:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2269:            [],
 2270:            fun(M) ->
 2271:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2272:                    ok
 2273:            end},
 2274:           {records7,
 2275:            ~"""
 2276:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2277:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2278:             """,
 2279:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "no_strict_record_tests"}],
 2280:            [no_strict_record_tests, strict_record_tests],
 2281:            fun(M) ->
 2282:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2283:                        3 ->
 2284:                            fail()
 2285:                    catch
 2286:                        error:{badrecord,{r,1,2,3}} ->
 2287:                            ok
 2288:                    end
 2289:            end}
 2290: 
 2291:          ],
 2292:     run(Config, Ts),
 2293:     ok.
 2294: 
 2295: %%%
 2296: %%% Utilities.
 2297: %%%
 2298: 
 2299: compile_and_verify(Name, Target, Opts) ->
 2300:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Name, ".erl")),
 2301:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, Opts),
 2302:     {ok,{Mod,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} = 
 2303: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
 2304:     {options,BeamOpts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
 2305:     Opts = BeamOpts.
 2306: 
 2307: get_unique_beam_files() ->
 2308:     get_unique_files(".beam").
 2309: 
 2310: get_unique_files(Ext) ->
 2311:     Wc = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "*"++Ext),
 2312:     [F || F <- filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 2313: 	  not is_cloned(F, Ext), not is_lfe_module(F, Ext)].
 2314: 
 2315: is_cloned(File, Ext) ->
 2316:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(File, Ext)),
 2317:     test_lib:is_cloned_mod(Mod).
 2318: 
 2319: is_lfe_module(File, Ext) ->
 2320:     case filename:basename(File, Ext) of
 2321: 	"lfe_" ++ _ -> true;
 2322: 	_ -> false
 2323:     end.
 2324: 
 2325: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 2326: 
 2327: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2328:     F = fun({N,P,Env,Ws,Run}, _BadL) when is_function(Run, 1) ->
 2329:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Env, Ws, Run) of
 2330:                     ok ->
 2331:                         ok;
 2332:                     Bad ->
 2333:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2334:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, ok, Bad]),
 2335:                         fail()
 2336:                 end;
 2337:            ({N,P,Env,Ws,Expected}, BadL)
 2338:               when is_list(Expected); is_tuple(Expected) ->
 2339:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 2340:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Env, Ws, none) of
 2341:                     Expected ->
 2342:                         BadL;
 2343:                     Bad ->
 2344:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2345:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, Expected, Bad]),
 2346: 			fail()
 2347:                 end
 2348:         end,
 2349:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 2350: 
 2351: run_test(Conf, Test0, Env, Options, Run) ->
 2352:     run_test_putenv(Env),
 2353:     Module = "warnings" ++ test_lib:uniq(),
 2354:     Filename = Module ++ ".erl",
 2355:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf),
 2356:     Test1 = ["-module(", Module, "). -file( \"", Filename, "\", 1). ", Test0],
 2357:     Test = iolist_to_binary(Test1),
 2358:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 2359:     Opts = [binary,export_all,return|Options],
 2360:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2361: 
 2362:     %% Compile once just to print all warnings (and cover more code).
 2363:     _ = compile:file(File, [binary,export_all,report|Options]),
 2364: 
 2365:     %% Test result of compilation.
 2366:     {ok, Mod, Beam, Warnings} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2367:     _ = file:delete(File),
 2368: 
 2369:     if
 2370:         is_function(Run, 1) ->
 2371:             {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
 2372:             ok = Run(Mod),
 2373:             run_test_unsetenv(Env),
 2374:             true = code:delete(Mod),
 2375:             _ = code:purge(Mod),
 2376:             ok;
 2377:         Run =:= none ->
 2378:             run_test_unsetenv(Env),
 2379:             Res = get_warnings(Warnings),
 2380:             case Res of
 2381:                 [] ->
 2382:                     [];
 2383:                 {warnings, Ws} ->
 2384:                     print_warnings(Ws, Test),
 2385:                     Res
 2386:             end
 2387:     end.
 2388: 
 2389: run_test_putenv(Env) ->
 2390:     _ = [_ = os:putenv(Name, Value) || {Name,Value} <- Env],
 2391:     ok.
 2392: 
 2393: run_test_unsetenv(Env) ->
 2394:     _ = [_ = os:unsetenv(Name) || {Name,_Value} <- Env],
 2395:     ok.
 2396: 
 2397: get_warnings([]) ->
 2398:     [];
 2399: get_warnings(WsL) ->
 2400:     case WsL of
 2401:         [{_File,Ws}] -> {warnings, Ws};
 2402:         _ -> {warnings, WsL}
 2403:     end.
 2404: 
 2405: print_warnings(Warnings, Source) ->
 2406:     Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 2407:     Cs = [print_warning(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 2408:     io:put_chars(Cs),
 2409:     ok.
 2410: 
 2411: print_warning({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 2412:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 2413:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 2414:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 2415:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 2416:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n",
 2417:                    [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 2418:      Line0, "\n",
 2419:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 2420: print_warning(_, _) ->
 2421:     [].
 2422: 
 2423: fail() ->
 2424:     ct:fail(failed).
